# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
function wrap_string(words::Vector{String}, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) <= text_width
            # Add the word to the current line
            current_line *= " $word"
        else
            # New line needed, add current line to lines list
            push!(lines, current_line)
            
            # Start a new line with the current word
            current_line = "$word"
        end
    end
    
    # Add the last line to the lines list
    push!(lines, current_line)

    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
words = ["Julia", "is", "a", "high-level", "programming", "language"]
wrapped_text = wrap_string(words)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This code defines a function `wrap_string` that wraps text based on a maximum width. The example usage demonstrates how to use the function with an array of words, and it prints the wrapped text to the console.
